citeinfo.title: Transit Routes - Twin Cities Metropolitan Area

descript.abstract:
The Transit Routes layer contains all fixed routes serving the Twin Cities regional metropolitan area. One shape and one corresponding record exists for each individual transit route.
The line work for the dataset was derived from The NCompass Technologies Street Centerline and Address Range dataset. A small number of line segments have been added to those available from the NCompass Technologies dataset to completely depict all routes traveled by fixed-route transit vehicles.
descript.purpose: To identify all locations in the Twin Cities metropolitan area where fixed-route transit routes exist.

timeperd.current: Transit Routes geography is updated weekly and includes linework from the NCompass street centerline dataset released in late summer or early spring.

theme.themekey: transit, buses, routes, streets, roads, transportation, Transit Routes, Bus Routes

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County, Sherburn County

citeinfo.title: NCompass Technologies Street Centerline and Address Ranges, transit segments, Transit Stops

attracc.attraccr: line_descr, route_type and route_oper are updated using information provided by Metro Transit's HASTUS scheduling software.. Attributes randomly checked by Metropolitan Council GIS staff.

dataqual.logic: This dataset contains one record and one PolyLine Shape for each route in the Metro area transit system.
dataqual.complete: The routes include routes which have service information provided on Metro Transit's website.

horizpa.horizpar:
Positional accuracy varies throughout the dataset. Most line work in most counties falls within the road right of way, often near the center. Recent realignments by the NCompass Street Centerline database have resulted in increased positional accuracy.
Text below taken from the former NCompass Technologies Street Centerline and Address Ranges metadata:
There are differing degrees of positional accuracy throughout the file. NCompass Technologies adjusts the positional accuracy of the data to available sources known to have a greater degrees of accuracy then those used to generate the existing data. However, in all cases (including instances where COGO line work has been the reference) NCompass Technologies generalizes the street segments to at least 4 feet in order to greatly reduce the number of vertices - thus reducing unnecessary file size and allowing for faster analysis.
The goal of NCompass Technologies is to have 95% of roads located to within the approximate center of digital right-of-way data or pavement centerlines provided from counties, where such digital data is available. In other areas, 95% of roads are intended to be within ten meters of the road or right-of-way center.

procstep.procdesc: This dataset was created in Giro's Hastus scheduling software and referenced the NCompass Technologies and Metro Transit street centerline dataset. See the metadata for the NCompass Technologies Street Centerline and Address Ranges layer for source information.

spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One layer for entire seven county region.

overview.eaover:
LINE ATTRIBUTES:
route: A number identifying the route number associated with the route and its schedules.
routesort: A numeric field identifying the route number associated with the route and its schedules
Routedescription (routedscrp): A brief description of the route.
routetype: A description of the type of route.
1 - Routes that provide a connecting link between urban local routes, and many times serve as suburban circulators. 2 - Routes that are radial, crosstown and limited stop services which primarily operate in the center cities. 3 - Routes that provide peak and all-day service traveling non-stop on highways for four or more miles. RouteOperator (route_oper): A description of the operator of the route. 'M' values represent routes are operated by Metro Transit. 'P' values represent routes not operated by Metro Transit. 'MP' values represent routes operated by Metro Transit and another transit provider.
EffectiveDate (effectived): The pick date
payleavedirectionid (payleavedi): The direction of a route where customers are required to pay when exiting the bus rather than boarding.
routepayleave (routepayle): Routes where customers pay fare when exiting the bus rather than boarding
twelvecolor (twelvecolo): An internal code used for cartographic dispalay
*_ftrip: The first trip time served by route at the the routes first stop per service period (Weekday, Saturday, Sunday)
*_ltrip: The last trip time served by route at the routes last stop per service period (Weekday, Saturday, Sunday)
*_span: The span of service by route in hours and mintues
